learning_outcomes.description: Describe modern wind measurement techniques (including their advantages and disadvantages)
Source, process and analyse a range of wind records
Explain atmospheric boundary layer theories and implement models describing it and its interaction with terrain and topography
Determine the wind loads on a range of different structures based on standards or wind tunnel results
Calculate the dynamic response of simple structures to wind loads
Undertake and analyse a wind tunnel experiment
Work in a team to analyse and report wind tunnel test data

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to analyse historic wind records and generate extreme value statistics.

This is an individual assignment.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will analyse wind tunnel experiment data and compare their results with those obtained from theory or design standards. 

This is a group assignment and a peer-assessment summarising the contribution from each team member is required with each submission.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(23 Feb - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial sessions

Tutorial sessions will be a mix of problem solving, example problems, demonstrations, time to discuss/work on assignments and course review.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial sessions Tutorial sessions will be a mix of problem solving, example problems, demonstrations, time to discuss/work on assignments and course review.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 3(23 Feb - 15 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Wind measurement/analysis lectures

Lectures will cover wind measurement instrumentation and techniques as well as statistical methods for analysing wind records.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Wind measurement/analysis lectures Lectures will cover wind measurement instrumentation and techniques as well as statistical methods for analysing wind records.

learning_activities.topic:
Introductory lectures

These lectures will introduce the course, wind engineering as a discipline and the range of wind events of importance to civil engineering.

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Introductory lectures These lectures will introduce the course, wind engineering as a discipline and the range of wind events of importance to civil engineering.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 5(09 Mar - 29 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Atmospheric boundary layer lectures

Conceptual, theoretical and engineering models of the atmospheric boundary layer will be introduced. Issues around turbulence, spectral analysis and boundary layer modification will be addressed.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Atmospheric boundary layer lectures Conceptual, theoretical and engineering models of the atmospheric boundary layer will be introduced. Issues around turbulence, spectral analysis and boundary layer modification will be addressed.

learning_activities.topic:
Wind tunnel testing and scaling

Theory and practice of wind tunnel testing

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Wind tunnel testing and scaling Theory and practice of wind tunnel testing

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 12(13 Apr - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Structural wind engineering lectures

Building aerodynamics, vibration and wind tunnel testing will be discussed. Issues around codification of these factors will also be discussed.


Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Structural wind engineering lectures Building aerodynamics, vibration and wind tunnel testing will be discussed. Issues around codification of these factors will also be discussed.

learning_activities.topic:
Wind tunnel experiment 1

Students will be required to run wind tunnel experiments and then analyse the results.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Wind tunnel experiment 1 Students will be required to run wind tunnel experiments and then analyse the results.

learning_activities.topic:
Wind tunnel experiment 2

Students will be required to run wind tunnel experiments and then analyse the results.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Wind tunnel experiment 2 Students will be required to run wind tunnel experiments and then analyse the results.

learning_activities.topic:
Review lecture

Main concepts of the course will be briefly reviewed.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Review lecture Main concepts of the course will be briefly reviewed.
